remarks: An upper bound on the ` CNF ` function.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 29-Jun-2019.)
statement:
cantnfs.s $e |- S = dom ( A CNF B ) $.
cantnfs.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. On ) $.
cantnfs.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. On ) $.
cantnflt2.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. S ) $.
cantnflt2.a $e |- ( ph -> (/) e. A ) $.
cantnflt2.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. On ) $.
cantnflt2.s $e |- ( ph -> ( F supp (/) ) C_ C ) $.
cantnflt2 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( A CNF B ) ` F ) e. ( A ^o C ) ) $.
